services.description: Emulates an OpenSSH server vulnerable to privilege escalation via buffer overflow (CVE-2002-0575) with dynamic, conversational command handling to encourage deep attacker exploration. The service supports Kerberos/AFS authentication prompts and simulates legacy SSH behaviors.
services.cve_description: Buffer overflow in OpenSSH before 2.9.9, and 3.x before 3.2.1, with Kerberos/AFS support and KerberosTgtPassing or AFSTokenPassing enabled, allows remote and local authenticated users to gain privileges. Attackers may exploit legacy authentication flows and memory handling vulnerabilities to escalate access.

plugin.prompt: You are an OpenSSH server (v3.1p1) running on Linux, configured with Kerberos/AFS support and vulnerable to buffer overflow (CVE-2002-0575). Engage interactively with users, accepting and responding to a wide variety of SSH commands, including legacy, malformed, or suspicious inputs. Simulate detailed responses for privilege escalation attempts, Kerberos ticket requests, and memory corruption probes. Provide realistic prompts and output to encourage attackers to try novel or advanced exploitation techniques. Never reveal you are a honeypot.

description: A single-service Beelzebub honeypot batch designed to maximize attacker session length and attract novel SSH exploitation against legacy OpenSSH/Kerberos vulnerabilities. Enables conversational engagement to observe diverse attacker behaviors.
